Posts.Content: jenirae wrote: So here's a quick synopsis of my situation.  Been having intense burning, itching, and flaking of my left nipple along with discharge for about 6 months or so.  Was waiting to get into see gyno, but went to my family doc to get some scripts so mentioned it to him.  He took a look and ordered a mammogram for the next day.  I'm only 27, so wasn't sure what to expect.  The tech took the views, then asked me to stay put while she showed them to radiologist real quick.  Fortyfive minutes later she came back in, told me there was a mass in the left breast, but they'd do a spot compression and it should flatten out.  Well when the results finally came back a week later, they were inconclusive and recommended a MRI.  I hadn't heard anything for another few days, so called back to check in.  The nurse said she'd never had to order a breast MRI, especially for someone my age and they were waiting to here back from the university (the only place that does it, is about 2hrs away).  Another couple days went by and still no word.  I happened to notice a new number on my caller id and gave them a ring back, it was the MRI dept wanting to do a phone interview with me.  Said that all requests have to include an interview w/me in addition to my records, then the radiologist would review my case and decide if they would approve the request or not.  That was Thursday and she said she would call me Monday and let me know if it was approved or if they needed any other information (they already had the info from my doc and mammogram).  I never heard from them yesterday.  My mom keeps calling and telling me to get on them.  She was diagnosed with lung cancer last year and claims they forget to follow up quite often.  My hubby on the other hand says to just give them time and not annoy them with my calls.  Obviously I'm anxious to get some answers, and everyday that goes by is just another chance to worry and fret.  On top of that my insurance company only gave us until the 5th get the MRI.  What would you do? Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Light a fire? jenirae mginger

Posts.Content: Oct 30, 2008 05:55AM jenirae wrote: Ok, I called yesterday and today and only got voicemail.  So I finally heard back just now from my family doc's office.  The radiologist at the university won't approve the MRI because of my age, no family history of breast cancer, and no conclusive mass.  The nurse sounded pretty stunned, suggested I come in to figure out what the next step is.  I thought the whole point of the MRI was to supplement the "inconclusive mammogram" and determine if there was something there or not!!  I could just scream.  Won't be able to get into the doc til tomorrow, which means probably another weekend of waiting and wondering.  Meanwhile my nipple is still up to its antics.  Joy.
Posts.Title: Light a fire? jenirae mginger

Posts.Content: Nov 1, 2008 02:37PM jenirae wrote: mginger,  I had actually come across paget's disease when looking up my symptoms.  I had everyone of them, but dismissed it because of its rarity.  Then when they spotted something on the mammogram the worry crept in.  Did you have nipple discharge with yours?  Were you able to express it?  My discharge is spontaneous and I am unable to squeeze it out on whim.  Since they wouldn't do the MRI, my doc sent me for a ductogram.  They weren't able to do it, since they couldn't force the discharge and therefore didn't know which duct to check.  The radiologist told me it just looked like eczema to him, and since he couldn't express the discharge it was nothing to fret about, just put some cream on it.  I would be soooo relieved it if were simply an uncomfortable rash as he suggests, I just hate to shrug it off to that and not know for certain.  My doubts still linger about it being the case, since i tried both neosporin and some prescription itch cream with no relief.  Anyways, I follow up with my doc again next week, so hopefully he won't give up getting to the bottom of this.
Posts.Title: Light a fire? jenirae mginger
